sub_title: Writer - director of animated realities. Tutor Eye Film Museum Amsterdam.
summary:
I'm an interdisciplinary filmmaker specializing in hybrid films and immersive projects, with a focus on animation and documentary. Due to my intuitive ability and high sensitivity, my antenna is tuned to trends and undercurrents in society. Social themes such as identity, individual freedom, autonomy, and self-determination are often the starting point for my projects.

I consider my work as activist art for change. As a creator, it is essential to me that my projects have an impact on different levels and challenge people. Through my initiatives, I aim to bring subcutaneous issues, often from an outsider's perspective, to an adult audience. My goal is to bring taboo topics out into the open and encourage audiences within social and political arenas to reflect on them.

A project is conceived, created, and produced together, never alone. Making a genuine connection is essential and serves as the foundation for trust, constructive collaboration, and the success of a project. That's why I'm always seeking alliances with other disciplines. This often begins with a cup of coffee and a casual, informal chat. I would like to extend an invitation to you to join me.

school.name: Kaboom Animation Festival, Imagine Film Festival, WeMakeVR and M31 Foundation

projects.title: Altijd al Anders
projects.description: "Altijd al Anders" is a web documentary which follows the lifetime crusade of an elderly lesbian lady and her fight against homophobia and prejudice. Inspiring for those who find homosexuality an unknown or difficult topic to talk about.

projects.description:
Odd One Out is a web documentary about the life and times of an elderly lesbian, Nanda. The chapters in her story explore Nanda’s personal struggles and her fight with the status quo. 
The setting is her residence – a retirement home – where Nanda dares to speak out and truly be herself.

contributors.headline: Writer - director of animated realities. Tutor Eye Film Museum Amsterdam.

profile_positions.description:
Animated documentary ( 25 min ). 
Journalist and activist Hai Yi fights censorship while keeping his homosexuality secret from his mother in China. Does the repression in his own life lead to Hai's drive to step up for the freedom of others? 

Scenario and pre-production development supported by the Netherlands Film Fund, 2016 and 2018. Producers Marc Thelosen, Koert Davidse, seriousFilm Netherland. Scenario coach Ernie Tee. Scenario advice Vincent Vanneste. Art director / head of animation Sverre Fredrikson. 

Production support by The Netherlands Film Fund, Fonds 21 (NL), VPRO Television (NL), Flanders Audiovisual Fund (VAF), Norwegian Filmsenter, Viken Filmsenter and the Norwegian Fritt Ord Human Rights Fund.
profile_positions.title: Breaking Walls | writer - director | in development

profile_positions.description:
I love to engage audiences and to interact with them about my personal experiences with filmmaking, especially when it comes down to facing the production challenges of animated documentaries. 

I have been facilitating workshops at: 
EYE International – MovieZone Amsterdam from 2014 – to present.  Focal Foundation for professional training in cinema and audio-visual at the International Animation Film Festival Animatou, Geneva Switzerland 2015 | Kunstbende Amsterdam 2015 | Stuttgart International Festival of Animated 2015 | IDS Academy Italian Doc Screening / Italian Doc Fest Academy, Palermo Italy 2016 | Willem de Kooning Academy Rotterdam 2016 | MovieZone at Socrates and Athena Gymnasium Leiden Netherlands 2017 |
profile_positions.title: Keynote speaker about the challenges of the animated documentary

profile_positions.description:
Installation of documentary, outsider art, animation, scent and sound design. OUTSIDER tells the story of Hans, a former psychiatric nurse, who after an incident at work is forced to reset and rearrange his life. The project is created in partnership with the Outsider Art Galerie in Amsterdam. 

Central to 'Outsider' is the story of Hans, a former psychiatric caretaker, who starts to question his metrics of success in life following a traumatic incident. In conversation with the artists of the Outsider Art Galerie, Hans searches for ways and permission to color his existence more freely.

Team: Direction/script Jan-Dirk Bouw, production Tünde Vollenbroek, art direction Iris Frankhuizen, animator Jing Yue Zwaan, installation Design Nikzad Arabshahi, sound design Mehrnaz Khorrami, script advisor Vincent Vanneste, interview recordings Studio Bart Jilesen, Bram Meindersma. Development funding Amsterdams Fonds voor de Kunsten & Stimuleringsfonds voor de Creatieve Industrie, supported by Anidox.
profile_positions.title: OUTSIDER - an immersive installation for daily grind weary adults.

profile_positions.description:
Documentary 2018 ( 50 min )
A cinematic, poetic document about monumental markings and symbolisms of symbiosis between humans and our planet. In the Anthropocene, our current geological period, man has so much impact on the earth's biosphere that it now rivals with the greatest forces of nature. Author and sociologist Ruben Jacobs explores how artists, baptized to artonauts, use science and technology to re-examine our relationship with the earth. 

Development funding by the Vevam Fund DirectorsNL.
profile_positions.title: Artounauts on expedition in the Anthropocene | writer - director | in development

profile_positions.description:
Animated youth drama with documentary elements ( 25 min ).  
Scenario Heleen Suèr. Animation Aimeé de Jongh. Production Submarine, Bruno Felix, Janneke van de Kerkhof. Selected for Nu of Nooit! animation 2015. Supported by the Netherlands Film Fund, Durch Mediafund and Zapp. Public Broadcasting Service AVRO-TROS.
profile_positions.title: Cackling like a hen - director | development

profile_positions.description:
Documentary ( 5 min ). Portuguese artist ‘Wasted Rita’ couldn’t care less that Sunday, once a sacred day is loosing it's tranquillity. Her straightforward opinions about the day she despises are interwoven with Sunday sceneries to create a filmic dialogue. Funded by the Goethe-Institute. Curator EUROPLY Film Dorothee Wenner, producer Meike Martens, Blinker Film productions, Cologne.

Script - director:	Jan-Dirk Bouw
Starring: 		 Rita Gomes
Camera:		        Joona Pettersson

Mix:			        Wiebe de Boer
Color grading:	Redline - Joel Sahuleka 	
Music:			Leo Frick
Post-production: 	Redline 
Production:             JDB Films - Jan-Dirk Bouw
profile_positions.title: SACRED SUNDAY | writer - director - producer |  realised

profile_positions.description:
Animated documentary ( 13 min ). A football hooligan feels unconditional love for his club. However, being gay, he has to hide his identity in order to survive in this world that is so precious to him. Production seriousFilm, coproduction Walking the Dog / Off World, Brussels. Development and production funding by the Dutch Film Fund. Coproduction funding by the Vlaams Audiovisueel Fund and Ufilm.

AWARDS:
WINNER - Professional Award for Dutch Animation - Holland Animation Film Festival - 2014
WINNER - MovieZone HAFF Award - Holland Animation Film Festival - 2014
WINNER - 11mm Short Kicks Film Competition - International football film festival "11mm", Berlin 2014
WINNER - Best Short Movie - Roze Filmdagen 2014 
WINNER - Best Independent Short Film of the International Competition - Animayo, Las Palmas de Gran Canaria 2014
WINNER - European Competition Fenêtres sur Courts in Dijon 2014
WINNER EUROPEAN COMPETITION - Fenêtres sur Courts, European short film festival - 2015
WINNER BEST SHORT FILM - BCN Sports Film Festival - 2015
GRAND PRIZE OF THE JURY - Animación Cartón BUENOS AIRES Argentina - 2015

FESTIVALS 2013 - 2018
210 International Film Festivals:
DOK Leipzig International Documentary Film Festival - Clermont Ferrand International Short Film Festival - Melbourne International Film Festival - Hong Kong International Film Festival - ZagrebDox Documentary Film Festival - Netherlands Film Festival - Holland Animation Film Festival.

profile_positions.title: Founder / chairman

profile_positions.description:
Scenario and directing: Odd One Out (30 min.) an interactive documentary about the life and activism of an elderly lesbian. 

Description
Odd One Out is a web documentary about the life and times of an elderly lesbian, Nanda Claessen. The chapters in her story explore Nanda’s personal struggles and her fight with the status quo. The setting is her residence – a retirement home – where Nanda dares to speak out and truly be herself.
 
The interactive website, ( to be launched may 2013 ) features film clips as well as information about organisations that visitors can consult for answers and support.

Plot / Logline
Nanda Claessen is out of the closet at her retirement home.
After years of inner struggle and conflict with those around her, Nanda continues her battle with prejudice and discrimination.

http://www.altijdalanders.nl
profile_positions.title: Odd One Out

profile_positions.description: Web documentary ( 25 min ). A lesbian woman in a home for the elderly stands up for her rights. Photography and camera Erwin Venema. Editor Rienk Leendertse. Funding by The Black Tea Party / Studio Erwin Olaf - Fuque les Balles, Trut and Tolerance United foundation.
profile_positions.title: ODD ONE OUT | writer - director - production | realised
